definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: My line hadcaught on a small chip in the lip.
sentences.chinese: 我的繩子剛好掛住了這隻瓷盤邊上的一個小缺口。

sentences.english: When you've fastened the boards, tie the strings off so that they don't slip.
sentences.chinese: 木板釘牢後，把繩子打結繫緊，免得鬆脫。

sentences.english: Two arms strech out naturally, even with one rope connecting two hands.
sentences.chinese: 用一根繩子綁住兩隻手，雙臂依然能夠展開。

sentences.english: The images of women barefoot on the street, handcuffed and tied to a rope, enraged internet users.
sentences.chinese: 被繩子綁住的婦女赤腳走在街上的畫面激怒了網民。

sentences.english: Then he slipped it back into his pocket.
Attach the ribbon and note to the collar of the cat or dog.
sentences.chinese: 把繩子和便籤掛在小貓或者小狗的脖子上。

sentences.english: At a signal, the fire men swarmed up the ropes.
sentences.chinese: 一聲令下，消防隊員們快速輕捷地爬上了繩子。

sentences.english: It also appears to have what looks like a string-like arm protruding from its body.
sentences.chinese: 它的身體外凸出的胳膊像繩子一樣細長。

sentences.english: He clung to the rope with both hands.
She grabbed the rope at teh critical moment.
sentences.chinese: 在這危急時刻她抓住了繩子。

sentences.english: Boycott all Chinese Goods until China puts Little Kim back on the dog leash.
sentences.chinese: 抵制所有中國產品，直到中國再給小金拴上狗繩子。

sentences.english: Ropes at that time was made from silk fibers, animal fur etc. Idea of making a rope came from vines.
sentences.chinese: 當時繩子是用絲織品和動物皮毛做的。

sentences.english: Now I must prepare the nooses and the rope to lash him alongside, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 現在我得準備好套索和繩子，把它綁在船邊，他想。

sentences.english: The young father did so and at once the young tree bent.
sentences.chinese: 年輕父親解開繩子，小樹馬上彎下了腰。
它們看上去像肉色的繩子。

sentences.english: He cut desperately at the rope in an attempt to free his foot.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命砍繩子，試圖把自己的腳解脫開。

definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
